line_1: And steady Justice holds th' impartial Scales.
line_2: Now settled Peace broods on the smiling Vales,

line_1: Heap up the measure, load the scales,
line_2: PRAISE above all — for praise prevails;

line_1: To weigh things in impartial scales:
line_2: LIKEWISE we see that Fate ne'er fails
While self o'er their feelings prevails.

line_1: Yet in that bulb, those sapless scales,

line_2: And marks if death or life prevails;

line_1: Blue Nereid-forms array'd in shining scales,
line_2: And pleased revisit in their sea-moss vales

line_1: A nation is an atom in her scales.
line_2: Justice regards not these — where right prevails,

line_1: Impartial Justice holds Her equal Scales;
line_2: If over Thee thy glorious Foe prevails;

line_1: A Bard — A Lord — let REASON take her Scales,
line_2: And fairly weigh those Words, see which prevails,

line_1: The Learned Mob bought Compasses and Scales,
line_2: And every Barber knew the Bay of Cales,

line_1: 'Tis thine to weigh the World in equal Scales,
line_2: And chide the conscious Soul, when Vice prevails,

line_1: Where-e're the Balance is, She holds the Scales.
line_2: She gives the Pow'r, whatever Side prevails,

line_1: Miss SCRATCHIT went in, and the Countess of SCALES,
line_2: Both Ladies of very great Fashion in Wales;

line_1: Throw loads of Incense in, to turn the Scales;
line_2: Then let Religion aid, where Reason fails:

line_1: Oppression flies, and Justice lifts her scales.
line_2: Where'er he goes, attending Truth prevails,

line_1: The little Greeks look trembling at the scales,
line_2: 'Till the best tongue or heaviest hand prevails.

line_1: I by injustice turn the scales,
